intro: Pavetta lanceisepala, commonly known as the lanceolate pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes well-known genera such as Rubia and Psychotria. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Pavetta lanceisepala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
